alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 3:04PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 304 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in northern Miami- Dade and far southern Broward counties. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected in the Miami Lakes and Miramar areas. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Miami Gardens, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Medley, Palm Springs North, Country Club and Pennsuco. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
